content: have your hair swatch finished this is what mine looked like wet it well squeeze it dry in a towel and set it aside for at least 3 days i had to do my dolls hair twice because the first time i hadn t wet it enough and had only let it set for 1 day i was impatient and the curls fell out and her hair was straight within a week… when you are ready unravel the hair swatch wrap it gently around something that is 3 inches wide i used my crochet hook case and cut one side so your pieces are 6 inches long don t pull it too tight you don t those curls to straighten out fold one piece in half use a crochet hook to pull the looped end through the head then pull the two ends through the loop and pull tight to form a knot fill in the head you don t have to fill in the entire head i completely fill in the first row or two then i fill in every other row and the row you are seeing here was the last row i did page 7 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com more pics of the finished doll page 8 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com
